commodities.event
Class GraphRedrawEvent

java.lang.Object
  java.util.EventObject
      commodities.event.GraphRedrawEvent
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class GraphRedrawEvent
extends EventObject

A GraphRedrawEvent indicates that a graph needs to be redrawn and gives the parameters in which to draw that graph.

Version:
1.0
Author:
J.R. Titko
See Also:
Serialized Form
Updated:
2004.11.11

Field Summary
private  Graphics graphics
          The graphics area that the graph is to be drawn in.
private  double maxValue
          The maximum value represented in the graph.
private  double minTickSize
          The minimum tick size the graph should use to stay in the graph boundries.
private  double minValue
          The minimum value represented in the graph.
private  int xScale
          The x-axis scale the graph should use to stay in the graph boundries.
private  double yScale
          The y-axis scale the graph should use to stay in the graph boundries.

Constructor Detail

GraphRedrawEvent

public GraphRedrawEvent(Object source,
                        Graphics g,
                        int xScale,
                        double yScale,
                        double minTickSize,
                        double maxValue,
                        double minValue)
Creates a GraphRedrawEvent so that graphs can be drawn appropriately in regards to other graphs that are sharing the same space.

Parameters:
source - The source of the event.
g - The graphics area to be drawn in.
yScale - The scale to be used for the y-axis
minTickSize - The smallest size of a pixel.
maxValue - The maximum value represented in the graph
minValue - The minimum value represented in the graph
